title: Slow Cooker Carnitas Recipe
description: In this easy slow cooker carnitas recipe, pork is simmered in a flavorsome broth to make a delicious filling for tamales, tacos, and burritos.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Latin American Mexican Slow Cooker Carnitas 4.6 (2,072) 1,503 Reviews 165 Photos This slow cooker carnitas recipe is easy to prep and makes a great filling for tamales, enchiladas, tacos, and burritos. This filling is also great combined with your favorite barbecue sauce and served on buns. Submitted by Erin Parker Updated on July 21, 2022 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 165 165 165 165 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 hrs Total Time: 10 hrs 10 mins Servings: 10 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 1 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon garlic powder 1 teaspoon ground cumin ½ teaspoon crumbled dried oregano ½ teaspoon ground coriander ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 (4 pound) boneless pork shoulder roast 2 bay leaves 2 cups chicken broth Directions Gather the ingredients. Mix salt, garlic powder, cumin, oregano, coriander, and cinnamon together in a bowl; coat pork with spice mixture. Place bay leaves in the bottom of a slow cooker and arrange pork on top. Pour chicken broth around the sides of pork, being careful not to rinse off spice mixture. Cover and cook on Low, turning after 5 hours, until pork shreds easily with a fork, about 10 hours in total. When the pork is tender, remove from the slow cooker; shred with two forks. Use cooking liquid as needed to moisten the meat. I Made It Print 3,481 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Slow Cooker Carnitas 01 of 165 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 165 Photo by  fabeveryday 11/30/2023 This was delicious! Definitely a keeper. Per other reviewers’ recommendations, I doubled all the spices except the cinnamon (kept that quantity as written) and it was just right. We made it into tacos. 03 of 165 Photo by  scasey70 02/03/2023 I took all the recommendations. Double the spices, except cinnamon, kept that as is here, and replaced garlic powder with fresh garlic cloves. Replace Added 1TBL of Chilli Powder as recommended. Cut meat into pieces, rubbed all and saved some rub to add after when we browned it in the pan with some juice. Let's just say the kids want this more. and no other version I've ever made before 04 of 165 Photo by  mel 03/06/2021 Super good! 05 of 165 Photo by  ambieb14 02/27/2021 06 of 165 Photo by  bessiedarlin 02/11/2021 This was delicious! We used pork chops (with bones since that's what I had - next time no bones for sure). We also did not add cinnamon (personal preference) and I did not have coriander but we did triple the amount of seasonings. OH! and we added about 6 cloves of fresh, chopped garlic (along w the granulated garlic). I shredded and mixed with laughing cow light cheese, and shredded cheddar then baked at 400F in a roasted, deseeded poblano. YUMMY! The kids ate the pork by itself. Thanks for a great recipe : ) 07 of 165 Photo by  casies 02/07/2021 Loved these! I used a 5lb bone in pork shoulder. Cooked about 8.5 hrs. Fantastic! 08 of 165 Photo by  raven 02/05/2021 09 of 165 Photo by  franciscamarti 09/24/2020 Delicious!!!! 10 of 165 Photo by  Hans 08/27/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Carnitas with Pico De Gallo 22 Ratings Authentic Cochinita Pibil (Spicy Mexican Pulled Pork) 17 Ratings Pressure Cooker Carnitas 127 Ratings Manteca Fried Carnitas 4 Ratings Mexican-Style Shredded Pork 542 Ratings Cochinita Pibil (Mexican Pulled Pork in Annatto Sauce) 3 Ratings Shredded Pork Taco Filling 9 Ratings Pork Carnitas 592 Ratings Pork Carnitas with Cilantro Tomatillo Sauce 98 Ratings Sous Vide Crispy Carnitas 3 Ratings Paleo Mexican Pulled Pork 10 Ratings Orange and Milk-Braised Pork Carnitas 103 Ratings Slow Cooker Pork Green Chili 5 Ratings Slow Cooker Mexican Pork Carnitas 7 Ratings Instant Pot Carnitas 467 Ratings Salsa Verde Pork 27 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Erin Parker
instructions: Gather the ingredients.;Mix salt, garlic powder, cumin, oregano, coriander, and cinnamon together in a bowl; coat pork with spice mixture.;Place bay leaves in the bottom of a slow cooker and arrange pork on top. Pour chicken broth around the sides of pork, being careful not to rinse off spice mixture.;Cover and cook on Low, turning after 5 hours, until pork shreds easily with a fork, about 10 hours in total.;When the pork is tender, remove from the slow cooker; shred with two forks. Use cooking liquid as needed to moisten the meat.
